alert.note: Alert for Ellis; Harper; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 12:06AM CDT until May 19 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Ellis County in northwestern Oklahoma... Northwestern Woods County in northwestern Oklahoma... Eastern Harper County in northwestern Oklahoma... Western Woodward County in northwestern Oklahoma... * Until 100 AM CDT. * At 1206 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles north of Buffalo to near May to 8 miles south of Follett, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Woodward, Shattuck, Buffalo, Arnett, Gage, Fargo, Fort Supply, Freedom, May, Alabaster Caverns State Park, Selman, Harmon, Tangier and Camp Houston. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
